_metadata.description: Routing index for Health context files - helps AI systems find relevant context

project.name: Health
project.purpose: Route questions to the right local context JSON files and apply global training + nutrition rules consistently.

time_anchor.rule: Convert any relative time references to absolute dates using timeline.json temporal_anchor.profile_anchor_date.

notes: All days are at least -400 kcal deficit.
Saturdays are -800 kcal deficit because they are easy rides.

macro_policy.rule: Protein grams fixed; when calorie target changes (e.g., eat-back from exercise), allocate added calories primarily to carbs (fat fixed unless explicitly overridden).

use_for: macro scaling rules when adding calories
priority_when: user asks how much to eat today
user asks macro targets
user asks how to adjust intake after a ride
user asks meal calorie splits
user asks 'when can I run' or time-to-race planning
user asks about phase changes
user references 'now' or relative dates

use_for: nutrition policy notes (eat-back fraction, carb scaling)
priority_when: user asks about safety, recovery, or bone-health constraints
user asks for fueling rules tied to training load
user asks for monitoring triggers (HRV, libido, bone pain)

use_for: risk context (e.g., vitamin B6 high, fasting glucose mildly high)
priority_when: user asks about supplements
user asks about lab interpretation
user asks if a change is medically risky

use_for: imaging reports and bone density scans
priority_when: user asks about diagnosis history
user asks about imaging results
user asks about bone density or fractures
user asks why they feel flat/tired
user asks to adjust training based on readiness
user asks about recovery patterns
user asks about skincare routine
user asks about shaving or ingrowns
user asks what products to use when
user asks for upper body workout details
user asks to modify aesthetics plan
user asks for minimal effective dose lifting
user asks for core/lower routine details
user asks for injury-resilient running strength
user asks for abs/obliques work that won't hurt running

conflict_resolution: If two files disagree, prefer the more specific plan file (upper-body-training.json or core-training.json) over general guidance.
If dates are involved, timeline.json overrides any implied timing elsewhere.

response_format_preferences.default: Start with what to do first. Then short reasoning. No filler.
output_modes: JSON-only update to a referenced plan
